| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1901](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1901 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **wallaby**, z, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") [zouthern animal](/wiki/Zouthern_animal "Zouthern animal") that possesses a kick and a bite attack.

## Strategy

Wallabies move at the same speed as a hasted and unburdened [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero"), and can deal decent damage with their attacks. However, said attacks are not very strong individually, making damage reduction from negative [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") a viable defense - a wallaby's poor 7 [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and lack of [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") also make them easy to impair or kill with [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") and [spells](/wiki/Spell "Spell").

In post-[NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") variants such as SpliceHack and Hack'EM, their speed can make them quite problematic if they get two moves per turn several times in a row.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Wallaby](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wallaby "wikipedia:Wallaby")***

A wallaby (/ˈwɒləbi/) is a small or middle-sized macropod native to Australia and New Guinea, with populations introduced in New Zealand, Hawaii, the United Kingdom and other countries. The term "wallaby" is an informal designation generally used for any macropod that is smaller than a kangaroo or a wallaroo that has not been designated otherwise; wallabies belong to the same taxonomic family and sometimes the same genus as kangaroos, but kangaroos are specifically categorised into the four largest species of the family.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

z wallaby
Difficulty 6
Attacks Kick 2d4, Bite 1d4
z wallaby
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Kick 2d4, Bite 1d4

Base level 5
Base experience 59
Speed 16
Base AC 7
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 400
Nutritional value 150
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A wallaby:

  • is an animal.
  • is herbivorous.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1901

A wallaby, z, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM, SpliceHack, and Hack'EM. It is a herbivorous zouthern animal that possesses a kick and a bite attack.

Strategy

Wallabies move at the same speed as a hasted and unburdened hero, and can deal decent damage with their attacks. However, said attacks are not very strong individually, making damage reduction from negative AC a viable defense - a wallaby's poor 7 AC and lack of MR score also make them easy to impair or kill with ranged attacks and spells.

In post-NetHack 3.4.3 variants such as SpliceHack and Hack'EM, their speed can make them quite problematic if they get two moves per turn several times in a row.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Wallaby

A wallaby (/ˈwɒləbi/) is a small or middle-sized macropod native to Australia and New Guinea, with populations introduced in New Zealand, Hawaii, the United Kingdom and other countries. The term "wallaby" is an informal designation generally used for any macropod that is smaller than a kangaroo or a wallaroo that has not been designated otherwise; wallabies belong to the same taxonomic family and sometimes the same genus as kangaroos, but kangaroos are specifically categorised into the four largest species of the family.

A '''wallaby''', {{monsym|wallaby}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]], [[SpliceHack]], and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a [[herbivorous]] [[zouthern animal]] that possesses a kick and a bite attack.

==Strategy==
Wallabies move at the same speed as a hasted and unburdened [[hero]], and can deal decent damage with their attacks. However, said attacks are not very strong individually, making damage reduction from negative [[AC]] a viable defense - a wallaby's poor 7 [[AC]] and lack of [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] also make them easy to impair or kill with [[ranged attack]]s and [[spell]]s.

In post-[[NetHack 3.4.3]] variants such as SpliceHack and Hack'EM, their speed can make them quite problematic if they get two moves per turn several times in a row.

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Wallaby}}
A wallaby (/ˈwɒləbi/) is a small or middle-sized macropod native to Australia and New Guinea, with populations introduced in New Zealand, Hawaii, the United Kingdom and other countries. The term "wallaby" is an informal designation generally used for any macropod that is smaller than a kangaroo or a wallaroo that has not been designated otherwise; wallabies belong to the same taxonomic family and sometimes the same genus as kangaroos, but kangaroos are specifically categorised into the four largest species of the family.
